name: DeepAlgebra
body:
**DeepAlgebra** is an open-source project in AI with a goal to automate formalization of mathematics and theorem proving. Especially we are interested in teaching machines to prove entirely new theorems, not proved before by humans. We concentrate on algebra and algebraic geometry.

## Plan:

The technical background for what we do is explained here: 

We currently want to implement a dictionary between (La)Tex and [COQ](https://coq.inria.fr) using syntactic parsers, and test it on [The Stacks Project](http://stacks.math.columbia.edu). The code will eventually appear on this website.

`Technical plan:`
* Build a dictionary by using [SyntaxNet](https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.9/tutorials/syntaxnet/index.html) or a similar syntactic parser to identify Types and variables in a mathematical text. Transfer those to COQ using a parse tree and a rule-based approach machine translation for environments and plain English. 
* Test this dictionary on the Stacks Project (a repository of facts from algebraic geometry).
* Proceed to verification and theorem proving using[ E ](http://wwwlehre.dhbw-stuttgart.de/~sschulz/E/E.html)in COQ and hammers (a deep learning method). 


## Our Team:

![](https://scontent-waw1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/v/t1.0-9/14191945_1273892569288505_8200014635490025595_n.jpg?oh=54de2a5aec70cc99e29692763bf4925d&oe=58665D05)

**Przemyslaw Chojecki** - founder of the DeepAlgebra project; born 1988, MD in mathematics from Ecole Polytechnique (Paris, France) and University of Warsaw (Poland), PhD in mathematics from Universite Pierre et Marie Curie, was a research fellow at University of Oxford from 2014 to 2016.  

If you want to join, write to: prz{dot}chojecki[at]gmail{dot}com, listing your experience and interests. We are currently looking for the implementation team, so anyone with advanced Python+TensorFlow skills is appreciated!
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
